item.title: Samagra Wealthmax Private Limited Acquires Additional 0.20% Stake in Starteck Finance Limited
item.description: Top News Samagra Wealthmax Private Limited Acquires Additional 0.20% Stake in Starteck Finance Limited 2 minutes ago Samagra Wealthmax Private Limited acquired 20,196 equity shares (0.20%) in Starteck Finance Limited through open market transactions between December 1-10, 2025. The acquisition increased the promoter group's total shareholding from 73.09% to 73.29%. The disclosure was made under SEBI regulations with the company noting it was done by way of abundant caution. Starteck Finance's equity capital remains unchanged at ₹9.91 crores comprising 99,10,330 shares of ₹10 each.

item.title: Globtier Partners with AWS for Cloud Solutions
item.description: Globtier Partners with AWS for Cloud Solutions 8 minutes ago Globtier Infotech Limited has formed a strategic partnership with Amazon Web Services (AWS) to enhance cloud adoption and digital transformation for global enterprises. The collaboration aims to improve Globtier's cloud consulting, migration, and managed services capabilities. The partnership targets sectors including BFSI, retail, automotive, manufacturing, and technology, offering services such as cloud optimization, cost management, secure architecture development, and comprehensive transformation support. Rajiv Shukla, Chairman and Managing Director of Globtier, emphasized that this collaboration is a significant milestone in the company's growth journey.

item.title: Max India Limited Allots 20,000 Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Plan
item.description: Max India Limited Allots 20,000 Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Plan 39 minutes ago Max India Limited allotted 20,000 equity shares under its ESOP Plan 2020 to eligible employees on December 12, 2025. The allotment increased the company's paid-up capital from ₹52.43 crores to ₹52.45 crores, with total equity shares rising to 5,24,50,362. The company made the disclosure in compliance with SEBI regulations to both stock exchanges.

item.title: Reliance Retail Considers IPO Within Three Years
item.description: Reliance Retail Considers IPO Within Three Years 3 hours ago Reliance Retail, India's largest retail chain and a subsidiary of Reliance Industries, has announced plans to potentially launch an Initial Public Offering (IPO) within the next three years. This move could provide investors an opportunity to participate in India's retail sector growth, enhance the company's access to capital, and increase operational transparency. As India's largest retail chain, Reliance Retail's potential IPO could be a significant event in the Indian market.
